GIFICE OF
DRAKSHARAMAShee 1
Page 2
You are my son. Out of my immense love and affection for you, I would like to give you some immovable property free of charge, and from the date of my name being registered in the Panchayat records, I have been in full possession of the property in Merakapolam village, a suburb of Bhatla Municipality, and from the date of my name being registered in the Panchayat records, I have duly transferred to you, without taking any consideration from you, the 265 sq m residential plot and the terrace, without any compensation, and I have duly transferred this settlement deed to you and have given you possession of the property on this very day. Therefore, from now on, you shall be the possessor and the full right holder of the Scheduled Property, and you, your son and grandson, shall enjoy the happiness of the hereditary succession to the moon and the stars forever, with all the rights of donation and sale, while paying the Panchayat taxes, etc. 
The Scheduled Property is a property without any transactions, i.e., without any purchases, purchase agreements, donations, guarantees, court seizures, any kind of share liabilities, and is an undisputed, unclaimed property in my full right of possession, the survey number, door number, measurements, boundaries are correct, and I have full right of possession in the said property, and I have told you, trusted you, and have given you this settlement deed in your name and we have taken possession of this settlement property this day itself. There are no allocations under the Government Act No. 9/77. This property does not fall within the scope of the Land Reforms Act, 1973. Schedule
Dr.|| B.R. Ambedkar Konaseema District, K. Gangavaram Mandal, Draksharama Sub Registrar's Office Jurisdiction in Bhatlapalika Gram Panchayat Area, Bhatlapalika Subdistrict Merakapolam Village Taluk R.S. No. 71 i.e. 265 sq.|| The dimensions and boundaries of the terrace with assessment no. 443 and door no. 3-87 are as follows: - East: 53 feet - Kudupudi Ramanamma garu's place, Katta Ramana garu's house: 53 feet - Panchayat road West North South: 45 feet 45 feet - My taluk place Polinati Jyoti garu's house Between the above four boundaries 265 sq m of living space is available, 636 sq m of terrace, 84 sq m of A spacious bathroom, including all fixtures, fittings, windows, electricity service, common water lines, custom paths, and all leasehold rights. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement deed No. 360 of 2026, dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Kate Satyanarayana in favour of His Son, Kate Srinu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 265 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 3-87, Ward number 3, comprised in survey number 71, situated in Bhatla Palika Shivaru Merakapolam Village, Bhatlapalika Grama Panchayath, K. Gangavaram Mandal, within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Draksharama (403) is bounded as follows: North by: 45 Ft., Site Of The Executant South by: House Of Polinati Jyothi East by: 53 Ft., Site Of Kudupudi Ramanamma And House Of Katta Ramana To Some Extent West by: 53 Ft., Panchayath Road.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
